subject: Programming
title: PHP and the Web
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: PHP and the Web.

hook.text: Rasmus Lerdorf just wanted to track visits to his online resume. He didn't plan a language.

buildup.text: His Personal Home Page tools grew into PHP â€” a quick way to build dynamic websites.

discovery.text: PHP embedded directly in HTML, so anyone with basic skills could build web apps.

twist.text: Developers mocked PHP for messy design. WordPress adopted it and now powers 40% of the web.

climax.text: PHP proved that practical beats elegant. The messy tool won because it was accessible.

punchline.text: The accidental language runs 40% of websites.
